sentences.en: Contrary to popular belief , many cats dislike milk.
sentences.cn: 与普通的看法相反，许多猫不喜欢牛奶。

sentences.en: David began to dislike all his television heroes who smoked.
sentences.cn: 戴维开始讨厌所有他曾喜欢的吸烟的电视偶像了。

sentences.en: Even though you dislike us, still and all you should be polite.
sentences.cn: 尽管你不喜欢我们, 但你仍然应该有礼貌.

sentences.en: He had taken an instant dislike to Mortlake.
sentences.cn: 他一到莫特莱克就觉得不喜欢这个地方。

sentences.en: He made no attempt to conceal his dislike of me.
sentences.cn: 他毫不掩饰对我的厌恶。

sentences.en: He may suddenly take a dislike to foods that he's previously enjoyed.
sentences.cn: 对以前爱吃的食物，他兴许突然就没了胃口。

sentences.en: I dislike the man; he has such a sharp tongue.
sentences.cn: 我不喜欢这个人, 他爱说刻薄挖苦的话.

sentences.en: I know you dislike him, but you paint him too black.
sentences.cn: 我知道你讨厌他, 不过你把他说得太坏了.

sentences.en: I took a violent dislike to him.
My dislike of thunder and even small earthquakes was due to Mother.
sentences.cn: 我对雷声甚至于轻微地震的厌恶都归因于我的母亲。

sentences.en: Norma is said to dislike the glare of publicity.
sentences.cn: 据说诺尔玛不喜欢被人过多关注。

sentences.en: She had a visceral dislike of all things foreign.
sentences.cn: 凡是外国的东西，她都打心眼儿里讨厌。

sentences.en: She took an instant dislike to me.
The divorce was painfully public, feeding her dislike of the press.
sentences.cn: 离婚的事张扬出去，她十分痛苦，更加厌恶媒体了。

sentences.en: They took an instant dislike to each other (= they disliked each other immediately ) .
sentences.cn: 他俩立刻就互相讨厌对方了。

sentences.en: Why do you dislike her so much?
Why do you dislike him so much?
sentences.cn: 你为什么那么讨厌他呢？

sentences.en: Years of dislike boiled over and blows were exchanged.
sentences.cn: 多年的厌恶之情终于爆发，双方拳脚相加。

trans.tran_en: Dislike is the feeling that you do not like someone or something
to think someone or something is unpleasant and not like them
to think someone or something is unpleasant and not like them
to think someone or something is unpleasant and not like them
to think someone or something is unpleasant and not like them
to think someone or something is unpleasant and not like them
